p: Similarly, the results revealed that the methanolic stem bark extract of P. thonningii at dose levels of 4 mg/kg bw, 20 mg/kg bw, and 100 mg/kg bw exhibited significantly lower percentage inhibition of xylene-induced ear oedema in experimental mice, compared with the percentage inhibition in mice treated with dexamethasone at a dose of 1 mg/kg bw ( p < 0.05; Figure 2).
